test.name: GWIS Project Construction Activities Organization Structure and Communication Requirements Test Module
test.description:
Select the best answer.
Once you begin the test you can exit however, you will have to restart from the beginning.
You may go back and change answers within the test.
Also note that to successfully pass the test you must complete the Post-Test with a score of 80% or greater.
The Pre-test can be failed as it is only used to establish a baseline score.
test.confirmationText: To confirm your test, click on the 'Next' button in the bottom right.

questionPool.name: Question 1
questionPool.instructions: Following proper communication channels will allow for what?

questionPool.name: Question 2
questionPool.instructions:
True or False: During a critical lift you notice that someone is unsafely positioned under a suspended load.
You should immediately call an “All Stop” without hesitation.

options.A: True: Anyone has Stop Work Authority whether there is real or perceived danger and unsafe practices.
options.B: False: It is important to inform the supervisor of a potential for unsafe conditions as he/she is the authority in charge.

questionPool.name: Question 3
questionPool.instructions:
If you are part of the GWIS Asset Construction Team and/or 3rd Party Vendor contracted by GWIS, who is it that
you must communicate project scope to in the event of any and all issues?

questionPool.name: Question 4
questionPool.instructions: True or False: Risks to a project if proper communication channels are not followed can include but not limited to compromise in safe work, NCR’s and unfavorable impacts to budget.

options.A: True: Deviating from communication protocol can result in negative outcomes that not only impact the project but also safe operations.
options.B:
False: As long as the communication comes from the client representative, it is in the projects best interest as they retain overall authority
on scope and project.

questionPool.name: Question 5
questionPool.instructions: True or False: If you are GWIS Asset Construction Team or 3rd Party Vendor and there is a change in scope from BP Operations/CTL it is your responsibility to do as requested.

options.A: True: This is true as the Client is responsible for the entire project and safety of the asset during execution offshore
options.B:
False: It is important to inform the Construction Manager as the scope of change may not be in alignment with the approved
procedures determined by the project team.
